Dear Ms. ONeill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. The corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Agency failed to provide the foster parent with a copy of the special Yes
evaluation report required by subrule (5) of R 400.12327 Special
evaluation rule, within 10 calendar days of its completion.
III. METHODOLOGY
06/29/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2020C0634022
07/08/2020 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
phone call with complainant
08/03/2020 Phone call with Well Spring Supervisor
08/13/2020 Exit meeting with supervisor
08/18/2020 Exit Conference
ALLEGATION: Agency failed to provide the foster parent with a copy of the
special evaluation report required by subrule (5) of R 400.12327 Special evaluation
rule, within 10 calendar days of its completion.
INVESTIGATION: On 7/8/2020 contact was made with the foster parent. Foster
parent stated Wellspring Lutheran Services - Gaylord failed to provide a copy of the
special evaluation report that was signed it on January 16, 2020 and placed in
MISACWIS on April 8, 2020. Foster parent received a copy of the special evaluation
report on June 8, 2020. Foster parent stated he did receive a letter for extension in
the appropriate time frame per R400.12327(3). Foster parent also stated he was told
his comments could be added to the file.
According to MiSACWIS the special evaluation was completed on 1/15/2020 and a
letter and the report was mailed to the foster parent on 6/4/2020.
On 8/3/2020 contact was made with Wellspring Lutheran Services - Gaylord
supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 stated they had a new licensing worker and the report
was not provided to the foster parent as required by R400.12327(5). Supervisor 1
stated she has talked with the licensing worker about the rule.
2

Based on interviews with the foster parent and Supervisor 1, and review of data in
MiSACWIS, the allegation is established.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days of its
completion.
ANALYSIS: Wellspring Lutheran Services - Gaylord failed to provide the
foster parent with a copy of the special evaluation report as
required by R400.12327(5).
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change to this
Child Placing Agency license – Private.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation established that Wellspring Lutheran Services Gaylord failed to provide a foster parent with a copy of a required special evaluation report within the mandated 10-day timeframe, delaying its receipt by approximately five months after completion. While the agency cited a new licensing worker as a factor, the facility and its supervision are ultimately culpable for this procedural failure.
